results.firPara: Joey Barton is to rejoin Burnley when the transfer window opens in January having agreed a deal that will tie him to Turf Moor until the end of the season.
results.secPara: The 34-year-old has been training with his former club since his contract with Rangers was terminated last month. In a statement, Burnley confirmed they had agreed terms with the midfielder on a deal until the end of the season – subject to international clearance once the transfer window opens in January.
results.webTitle: Joey Barton to make return to Burnley when January window opens

results.firPara: While its hard to measure exactly his impact on his team and the A-League, Melbourne Citys marquee signing can be satisfied with his homecoming

results.firPara: The Huddersfield Town manager, David Wagner, has pledged his future to the Championship club following speculation linking him with the Bundesliga side Wolfsburg.
results.secPara: Wagner, 45, was reported by various German news outlets on Monday to have been lined up as a replacement for the current Wolfsburg coach, Valérien Ismaël.
results.webTitle: David Wagner pledges future to Huddersfield amid Bundesliga interest

results.firPara: Sir Bernard Hogan-Howe had said investigation has concluded I did nothing wrong even though inquiry continues

results.firPara: Newcastle United are expected to appeal against Jonjo Shelveys five-match suspension and £100,000 Football Association fine after an independent disciplinary commission found the former England midfielder guilty of directing racially aggravated language towards an opponent.
results.secPara: That misconduct charge was imposed following allegations that arguably Rafael Benítezs most influential player directed racially abusive language towards Romain Saïss, a Moroccan midfielder, in the 87th minute of the 2-0 Championship defeat by Wolverhampton Wanderers at St James Park on 17 September.
results.webTitle: Newcastle set to appeal against Jonjo Shelvey’s five-match ban for racial abuse
